code: @Manual{,   title = {weathervane: Functions to Download Australian Weather Data},   author = {Russell Edson and Sam Rogers},   year = {2023},   note = {R package version 0.2.0},   url = {https://biometryhub.github.io/weathervane/}, }

what: Functions to Download Australian Weather Data
title: Functions to Download Australian Weather Data
text: Easily navigate retrieve weather datasets anywhere Australia! weathervane package aids researchers retrieving Australian weather climate data (sourced SILO Bureau Meteorology) incorporate statistical analyses agronomic experiments, plant-breeding trials research. R package includes simple user-friendly Shiny App retrieving weather data, complete interactive map, data previews CSV spreadsheet export. weathervane App Alternatively, load library use weather data retrieval functions directly statistical analysis workflow. weathervane package

title: Functions to Download Australian Weather Data
text: Run following code R console install package:

title: Functions to Download Australian Weather Data
text: Load package start using :

title: Functions to Download Australian Weather Data
text: Invoke get_weather_data together latitude longitude (decimal degrees Northing/Easting, respectively), start date (Date object ‘YYYY-MM-DD’ string). Optionally, specify end date ; default, function grab data recent possible date. function returns weather data neat data frame. Example: grab week’s worth weather data Adelaide CBD (-34.9285°N, 138.600°E) 01/01/2021 07/01/2021 inclusive: default, possible weather variables returned. wish fine-tune selection variables retrieved server, can done specifying variables individually. (See weather_variables variables available codes.) Example: suppose want rainfall maximum temperature data Sydney CBD (-33.8688°N, 151.2093°E) first week June, 2020:
code: get_weather_data(-34.9285, 138.6007, '2021-01-01', '2021-01-07') get_weather_data(   latitude = -33.8688,    longitude = 151.2093,    start_date = '2020-06-01',    finish_date = '2020-06-07',   variables = c('rainfall', 'max_temp') )

title: Functions to Download Australian Weather Data
text: (Note: Requires shiny, ggplot2, leaflet R6 packages installed locally GUI.) Shiny app provides user-friendly front-end weathervane library functions, including interactive map variable list, easy export CSV spreadsheet format. Load app R console :

title: Functions to Download Australian Weather Data
text: weather datasets currently retrieved weathervane curated SILO, make available Creative Commons Attribution 4.0 International Licence. data turn mostly sourced Australian Bureau Meteorology weather stations. Please reference appropriately publications research outputs use downloaded weather data. See example: https://www.longpaddock.qld.gov.au/silo//access-data/ http://www.bom.gov.au//copyright.shtml

title: Functions to Download Australian Weather Data
text: weathervane package app developed Russell Edson Sam Rogers University Adelaide’s Biometry Hub. hope package useful Australian researchers easily retrieving weather data incorporate statistical analyses. Send bug reports, questions comments biometryhubdev@gmail.com open issue GitHub.

what: The download URL for the SILO weather data download — download_url
title: The download URL for the SILO weather data download — download_url
text: Return character string containing parameter-formatted download URL SILO data, given latitude/longitude coordinates, start finish dates interest, list variables retrieved.

title: The download URL for the SILO weather data download — download_url
code: download_url(latitude, longitude, station, start_date, finish_date, variables)

title: The download URL for the SILO weather data download — download_url
text: latitude latitude (decimal degrees North) longitude longitude (decimal degrees East) station numeric BoM station ID start_date string Date object starting date finish_date string Date object finish date variables vector containing variable names

title: The download URL for the SILO weather data download — download_url
text: parameter-formatted URL data download

title: The download URL for the SILO weather data download — download_url
code: weathervane:::download_url(   latitude = -34.9, longitude = 138.6,   start = '2020-01-01', finish = '2020-12-31',   variables = c('rainfall') ) #> [1] "https://www.longpaddock.qld.gov.au/cgi-bin/silo/DataDrillDataset.php?lat=-34.9&lon=138.6&format=csv&username=biometryhubdev@gmail.com&password=apirequest&start=20200101&finish=20201231&comment=R" weathervane:::download_url(   station = 40004,   start = '2020-01-01', finish = '2020-12-31',   variables = c('rainfall') ) #> [1] "https://www.longpaddock.qld.gov.au/cgi-bin/silo/PatchedPointDataset.php?station=40004&format=csv&username=biometryhubdev@gmail.com&password=apirequest&start=20200101&finish=20201231&comment=R"

title: Get a list of all weather stations — get_all_stations
Get a list of all weather stations — get_all_stations
text: sort_by column sort stations . Valid values "name" (default), "distance" (Alice Springs), "id" "state".

title: Get a list of all weather stations — get_all_stations
text: data.frame weather stations along BoM station ID, Station name, Latitude, Longitude, State Elevation.

title: Get a list of all weather stations — get_all_stations
code: head(get_all_stations()) #>      ID                             Name Latitude Longitude State Elevation #> 1 41497                 AAC DALBY CAMPUS -27.1494  151.2894   QLD       347 #> 2 40000                       ABBOTSFORD -27.9500  153.1000   QLD        48 #> 3 39000                         ABERCORN -25.1333  151.1292   QLD       200 #> 4 63000 ABERCROMBIE (ABERCROMBIE BRIDGE) -33.9541  149.3252   NSW       435 #> 5 61000               ABERDEEN (MAIN RD) -32.1655  150.8911   NSW       183 #> 6 61065              ABERDEEN (ROSSGOLE) -32.1402  150.7285   NSW       543 head(get_all_stations(sort_by = "id")) #>     ID             Name Latitude Longitude State Elevation #> 1 1001      OOMBULGURRI -15.1806  127.8456    WA       2.0 #> 2 1005     WYNDHAM PORT -15.4644  128.1000    WA      20.0 #> 3 1006     WYNDHAM AERO -15.5100  128.1503    WA       3.8 #> 4 1009         KURI BAY -15.4875  124.5222    WA      12.0 #> 5 1010            THEDA -14.7885  126.4963    WA     210.0 #> 6 1012 MITCHELL PLATEAU -14.7925  125.8258    WA     315.0

title: Get station details from a provided (partial) name — get_station_by_name
code: # Search by name get_station_by_name("Brisbane") #>      ID                       Name Latitude Longitude State Elevation #> 1 40140                MT BRISBANE  -27.149   152.578   QLD     100.0 #> 2 40214   BRISBANE REGIONAL OFFICE  -27.478   153.031   QLD      38.0 #> 3 40215 BRISBANE BOTANICAL GARDENS  -27.483   153.033   QLD      15.0 #> 4 40216      BRISBANE SHOW GROUNDS  -27.451   153.033   QLD      16.0 #> 5 40223              BRISBANE AERO  -27.418   153.114   QLD       4.0 #> 6 40842              BRISBANE AERO  -27.392   153.129   QLD       4.5 #> 7 40913                   BRISBANE  -27.481   153.039   QLD       8.1  # Find a specific station get_station_by_name("Adel (Waite)") #>      ID                       Name Latitude Longitude State Elevation #> 1 23031 ADELAIDE (WAITE INSTITUTE)   -34.97   138.633    SA       115  # Will return any stations containing "botanic", "botanical" or "botany" get_station_by_name("botan*") #>       ID                                     Name Latitude Longitude State #> 1  14163                   DARWIN BOTANIC GARDENS  -12.440   130.838    NT #> 2  40215               BRISBANE BOTANICAL GARDENS  -27.483   153.033   QLD #> 3  66006                   SYDNEY BOTANIC GARDENS  -33.866   151.216   NSW #> 4  66007                          BOTANY NO.1 DAM  -33.933   151.217   NSW #> 5  70247 CANBERRA (AUSTRALIAN NATIONAL BOTANIC GA  -35.278   149.109   NSW #> 6  86232              MELBOURNE BOTANICAL GARDENS  -37.831   144.984   VIC #> 7  86375               CRANBOURNE BOTANIC GARDENS  -38.135   145.264   VIC #> 8  89001               BALLARAT BOTANICAL GARDENS  -37.549   143.819   VIC #> 9  90023                  COLAC BOTANICAL GARDENS  -38.300   143.600   VIC #> 10 94030                 HOBART BOTANICAL GARDENS  -42.867   147.332   TAS #>    Elevation #> 1       15.2 #> 2       15.0 #> 3       15.0 #> 4        6.1 #> 5      585.0 #> 6       29.0 #> 7       85.0 #> 8      456.0 #> 9      133.2 #> 10      27.0

what: Retrieve weather data for the given station ID and dates — get_station_data
title: Retrieve weather data for the given station ID and dates — get_station_data
text: Return data frame containing SILO Australian weather data specified weather station, date range (start_date finish_date, inclusive) specified variables. default, available weather variables returned none specified. finish date provided, date range taken given start date today's date (.e. recently uploaded weather information SILO server, updated daily).

title: Retrieve weather data for the given station ID and dates — get_station_data
code: get_station_data(   station,   start_date,   finish_date = Sys.Date(),   variables = weather_variables()$variable_name,   pretty_names = TRUE )

title: Retrieve weather data for the given station ID and dates — get_station_data
text: station numeric station ID, else character station name. start_date string Date object starting date finish_date string Date object finish date (Default: today's date, retrieves recently updated weather data available) variables vector containing variable names (Default: retrieve available weather variables) pretty_names Whether format columns prettied variable names (Default: TRUE). Set FALSE format column names syntactically valid variable names (cost readability)

title: Retrieve weather data for the given station ID and dates — get_station_data
text: data.frame containing downloaded weather data

title: Retrieve weather data for the given station ID and dates — get_station_data

what: Retrieve weather data for the given location and dates — get_weather_data
title: Retrieve weather data for the given location and dates — get_weather_data
text: Return data frame containing SILO Australian weather data specified latitude/longitude, date range (start_date finish_date, inclusive) specified variables. default, available weather variables returned none specified. finish date provided, date range taken given start date today's date (.e. recently uploaded weather information SILO server, updated daily).

title: Retrieve weather data for the given location and dates — get_weather_data
code: get_weather_data(   latitude,   longitude,   start_date,   finish_date = Sys.Date(),   variables = weather_variables()$variable_name,   pretty_names = TRUE )

title: Retrieve weather data for the given location and dates — get_weather_data
text: latitude latitude (decimal degrees North) longitude longitude (decimal degrees East) start_date string Date object starting date finish_date string Date object finish date (Default: today's date, retrieves recently updated weather data available) variables vector containing variable names (Default: retrieve available weather variables) pretty_names Whether format columns prettied variable names (Default: TRUE). Set FALSE format column names syntactically valid variable names (cost readability)

title: Retrieve weather data for the given location and dates — get_weather_data
text: data.frame containing downloaded weather data

title: Retrieve weather data for the given location and dates — get_weather_data
code: weather_data <- get_weather_data(-34.9, 138.6, '2021-01-01', '2021-01-30', pretty_names = FALSE) colnames(weather_data) #>  [1] "Date"                                                             #>  [2] "Latitude"                                                         #>  [3] "Longitude"                                                        #>  [4] "Elevation..m."                                                    #>  [5] "Rainfall..mm."                                                    #>  [6] "Minimum.Temperature..degC."                                       #>  [7] "Maximum.Temperature..degC."                                       #>  [8] "Relative.Humidity.at.Minimum.Temperature...."                     #>  [9] "Relative.Humidity.at.Maximum.Temperature...."                     #> [10] "Solar.Exposure..MJ.m2."                                           #> [11] "Mean.Pressure.at.Sea.Level..hPa."                                 #> [12] "Vapour.Pressure..hPa."                                            #> [13] "Vapour.Pressure.Deficit..hPa."                                    #> [14] "Evaporation..mm."                                                 #> [15] "Morton.s.Shallow.Lake.Evaporation..mm."                           #> [16] "FAO56.Short.Crop.Evapotranspiration..mm."                         #> [17] "ASCE.Tall.Crop.Evapotranspiration..mm."                           #> [18] "Morton.s.Areal.Actual.Evapotranspiration..mm."                    #> [19] "Morton.s.Point.Potential.Evapotranspiration..mm."                 #> [20] "Morton.s.Wet.environment.Areal.Potential.Evapotranspiration..mm." head(weather_data[,1:6]) #>         Date Latitude Longitude Elevation..m. Rainfall..mm. #> 1 2021-01-01    -34.9     138.6          42.2             0 #> 2 2021-01-02    -34.9     138.6          42.2             0 #> 3 2021-01-03    -34.9     138.6          42.2             0 #> 4 2021-01-04    -34.9     138.6          42.2             0 #> 5 2021-01-05    -34.9     138.6          42.2             0 #> 6 2021-01-06    -34.9     138.6          42.2             0 #>   Minimum.Temperature..degC. #> 1                       14.5 #> 2                       16.7 #> 3                       16.8 #> 4                       16.4 #> 5                       13.5 #> 6                       14.4  weather_data <- get_weather_data(   -34.18, 139.98, '2020-01-01', '2020-03-31', c('rainfall', 'max_temp') ) head(weather_data) #>         Date Latitude Longitude Elevation (m) Rainfall (mm) #> 1 2020-01-01   -34.18    139.98          41.0           0.0 #> 2 2020-01-02   -34.18    139.98          41.0           0.0 #> 3 2020-01-03   -34.18    139.98          41.0           0.0 #> 4 2020-01-04   -34.18    139.98          41.0           0.0 #> 5 2020-01-05   -34.18    139.98          41.0           9.2 #> 6 2020-01-06   -34.18    139.98          41.0           7.1 #>   Maximum Temperature (degC) #> 1                       30.7 #> 2                       35.3 #> 3                       42.2 #> 4                       28.6 #> 5                       15.4 #> 6                       29.1

what: True if the given coordinates are in Australia — in_australia
title: True if the given coordinates are in Australia — in_australia
text: Return TRUE given latitude longitude within 'bounds' Australia, define bounds spatial extent rasters used SILO (also Bureau Meteorology) gridded datasets. NOTE: bounds include parts Indonesia Papua New Guinea, SILO server processes coordinates just fine worry interface.

title: True if the given coordinates are in Australia — in_australia
True if the given coordinates are in Australia — in_australia
text: latitude latitude (decimal degrees North) longitude longitude (decimal degrees East)

title: True if the given coordinates are in Australia — in_australia
text: TRUE coordinates within Australia, FALSE

title: True if the given coordinates are in Australia — in_australia
